results.title: Website Marketing Manager
results.description:
Why We’re Hiring:

We are looking for a Website Marketing Manager to drive growth and continuous improvement to the Harvest website, our most valuable marketing asset.

In this role, you will collaborate with key business stakeholders (demand gen, product marketing, engineering, design, content, etc.) and external agency partners to develop, maintain, and support all marketing initiatives related to the Harvest website. These initiatives include, but are not limited to: SEO & CRO management, website performance monitoring, technical maintenance, implementation of web best practices, web development, and more.

To be successful in this role, you should be curious, analytical, and creative, applying your web marketing expertise to maximize our website's marketing performance.

Requirements

What You’ll Do:

You will serve as the gatekeeper of Harvest’s website, which includes:

  • Website Performance Monitoring:
    • Establish, maintain and update health metrics for the Harvest website
    • Identify Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for web metrics
    • Configure, manage, monitor, and update Google Analytics, Google Search Console, etc., in cross-collaboration with key business stakeholders and external agency partners
    • Develop performance reports and dashboards to reflect website performance
    • Identify and develop strategies to grow subscriber base and web traffic metrics
  • Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Management:
    • Develop and implement CRO tests in collaboration with Demand Gen Lead and periodically with our external CRO agency partner
    • Monitor test performance, establish and provide reporting metrics and recommendations based on each test
    • Conceptualize new tests (design layout & content) working in collaboration with product marketing expert, designer and content writer
  • Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Management:
    • Working closely with Demand Gen lead and external SEO agency to implement SEO recommendations; provide input and contribute to overall SEO strategy based on visitor interaction/behavior
    • Identify gaps/opportunities and make suggestions on ways to continuously update our site (content and structure) to improve SEO
    • Monitor organic search rankings and provide regular reporting to Marketing team and agency partner
  • Web Development & Technical Maintenance:
    • Manage website content, conducting audits to eliminate redundant, outdated, or duplicate content
    • Create and update landing pages in collaboration with the Demand Generation lead
    • Implement design updates in collaboration with the Creative Design Manager, ensuring the website aligns with brand strategy and meets the organization’s design standards
    • Create, update, and maintain CMS templates and modules
    • Respond to and troubleshoot all website issues
    • Recommend and implement regular improvements to the user experience
    • Ensure full compliance of the website with all laws and regulations (i.e. GDPR)
    • Keep up-to-date with industry best practices and monitor competitor websites
What You’ll Do:
  • Proven work experience as a Website Marketing Manager, Online Marketing Manager or similar role (5+ years of experience preferred)
  • BS degree in Marketing, Business Administration or relevant field
  • Extensive knowledge of website performance/optimization principles and strategies
  • Experience with CRM/CMS software (i.e., HubSpot; Built and maintained HubSpot CMS themes, templates, and modules, or a similar platform
  • Highly proficient with HTML and CSS
  • Basic knowledge of Javascript, HubL
  • Experience managing code with Git
  • Managed and maintained platforms such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Google AdWords, Optimizely, and more.
  • Project management experience
  • Detailed understanding of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO)
  • Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot website issues in a timely, urgent manner
  • Established key web metrics, identified areas for improvement, and implemented those changes
  • Appetite and effort to stay up to date on the latest trends
  • Strong attention to detail with an analytical mind to problem-solve
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision while delivering results

    Benefits

    • Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
    • Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
    • Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
    • Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
    • Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
    • Short Term & Long Term Disability
    • Training & Development
    • Work From Home
    • Wellness Resources

results.title: Senior Marketing Operations Manager
results.description:
From product marketing to sales enablement to customer success to finance - and more, we’re home to 14 (at the time of writing!) thriving communities that collectively unite 100,000+ professionals worldwide. Organisations partner with us to reach our niche engaged communities through branding, thought leadership, and lead generation programs.

 

We’re a fast-growing and moving org and we need an experienced MarOps whizz to help us ensure we’re operating efficiently, leveraging automations, have accurate + easy-to-access reporting & dashboards at our fingertips - and more.

 

Reporting to the CMO, you’ll:

 

  • Own the end-to-end build and maintenance of the entire marketing department’s reporting and dashboards using platforms like Salesforce, Google Data Studio, Geckoboard, and more.

  • Work with the various marketing pillars to identify opportunities in our journeys based on data and disseminate insights and actions to implement.

  • Be a key cog in the marketing and sales relationship and ensure our campaigns, processes, and tracking are seamlessly integrated and optimized.

  • Work with the wider RevOps team to ensure our CRM captures the information we need to report on marketing effectiveness and roll out iterations to constantly enhance our activities.

  • Help define high-performing lead scoring criteria for our various revenue streams so we can capture and fill quality pipelines per product.

  • Lead on marketing attribution best practice across departments to support marketing spend on the right channels.

  • Lead on processes automation, making sure we operate at maximum efficiency, delivering the right messages, at the right prospects, at the right time.

  • Co-ordinate marketing launches to ensure all departments are aligned, on track, and set-up for success.

  • Line management responsibility of our Data Operations Exec to ensure all new data is nurtured effectively and that our campaigns are continually optimized.

  • Support with the integration of new tools and tech as and when required and ensure they are correctly implemented and adopted.

  • Own the week-to-week maintenance of Segment (our CDP) as well as any integrations and new audience requests as required.

  • Vet new tools and tech as required to ensure they’re fit for purpose, integrate with the rest of our stack, and help us achieve our goals - as well as proactively spotting gaps in our existing tech stack.

 

Requirements:

 

  • 2-3 years experience in a MarOps role.

  • Experience using Segment, Salesforce, Zapier, GDS and GA4.

  • You’re a natural and proactive problem-solver with a process-driven mindset.

  • You’ve got great communication skills with key stakeholders across departments.

  • You are naturally self-directed, operate at a high cadence, and get stuff done with minimum supervision.

  • You're passionate about using and understanding the data behind WHY things happen and use this to shape your campaigns.

  • You expertly balance and prioritize your daily to-do's, as well as your short-term and long-term planning.

  • You are an extraordinary teammate always willing to jump in and offer support and say "yes" to taking on new things.

  • Confidence to experiment with different tactics, shake up strategy, adapt to new trends, to incorporate business changes, or to bounce back from subpar results.

  • You thrive in a fast-paced start-up, target -driven environment.

Benefits:

Competitive Salary

 

Enhanced paid holiday: 

  • 34 days including UK Bank holidays and a day off on your birthday

Private Medical & Dental

 Life Insurance: (4 x salary)

 

Wellbeing:

  • On-demand therapy, coaching & mental fitness via Oliva

  • Heavily subsidised gym membership via Gympass

  • Cycle to work & Workplace Nursery schemes

  • Early bird or night owl? Our flexible hours policy allows you to structure your work for when your most productive

     

Flexible benefits via the thanksBen platform:

  • £600 annually in year 1 scaling to over £1,980+ annually based on the length of service

     

Learning & Development:

  • Personal L&D budget £500 annually in year 1 scaling to £3000+ annually based on length of service

 

Volunteer & L&D Days:

  • We offer 1 additional paid day per quarter for you to dedicate to either L&D or Charity/ Volunteer activities

     

New tech gear: 

  • Laptop, screen, mouse, keyboard. We got you covered.

     

Company social events

results.title: Associate Director, Marketing
results.description:
About TKS:

The Knowledge Society (TKS) is a global human accelerator focused on developing young people (ages 13-18) to impact billions. In TKS, students learn about solving problems using emerging technologies, develop foundational mindsets, and build real-world skills, while being part of a global community of like-minded people.

Our vision is to help create the next generation of unicorn people - people who impact billions. In 2020, TKS was recognized by The World Economic Forum as a "School of the Future" and was also featured in Forbes, BBC, Fast Company etc..

We currently have 2,500+ students and alumni from over 200 cities globally. Our alumni have started venture-backed companies, performed cutting-edge research, presented at the world's largest conferences, and are creating solutions to tackle important problems like maternal mortality, disease, and energy.

 

As our Associate Director, Marketing at TKS:

  • You’re not marketing the next fad, eCommerce solution, or marketplace app - you'll be helping future leaders access world-class coaching and mentoring, impacting the course of young people's lives, and making positive change.

  • With your help, we will be able to change the education industry for the better by creating global awareness about TKS' mission, vision, and program delivery model — helping us communicate our 'school of the future' model to new global audiences and convert prospects into students. Ultimately the goal here is to popularize that new Education models exists and work.

  • You’ll be getting in on the ground-level. With big expansion plans for 2023 and beyond, we're gaining momentum. Despite our huge impact to-date, we're still a lean team - join us as we begin to scale on our journey to become the leader in education. Your role will grow as TKS expands.

 

How You’ll Add Value:

  • Generate 6,000 submitted applications for our virtual program next year

  • Generate 400 submitted applications per city in five different cities

  • Transform TKS into a world-class brand that attracts the most ambitious students from around the world

More specifically, your performance will be measured on three areas:

1 - Applications and Growth,

2- Brand Growth,

3- Team/resource management

Applications and Growth

  • Setting growth goals and strategies in each market, setting and tracking KPIs for each individual team member and channel

  • Ensure we’re adhering to target CAC and CPL

  • Project manage/oversee each team member's responsibilities for lead and application generation in areas like schools and youth organizations, events, social media marketing, SEO, and conversion optimization.

  • Own all paid initiatives, including ads on Tiktok, Google ecosystem, Instagram, Snapchat, affiliate marketing, paid newsletters and sponsorship

  • Set up dashboards and tracking for applications and paid initiatives

Brand

  • Help TKS get recognized by global influencers and outlets

  • Overview of content strategy and review all content produced by communications specialist and - approving content and messaging, helping optimize content to focus on based on data and metrics

  • Key channels: Organic social - Instagram, Youtube (and Shorts), Tiktok, LinkedIn, Twitter, newsletter/discord server

  • Ensure the marketing team is adhering to brand guidelines and voice

  • Scheduling video/photo capture opportunities, creative briefs and managing contractors as needed for brand assets

Team Management

  • Owning all budgeting, reporting and team management

  • Project management of all team tasks on Asana, Google Suite, etc…

  • Ensuring communications between the program, operations, partnerships and marketing teams are smooth

  • Understanding team hiring needs and assisting with the recruitment and hiring/onboarding and platform access process

 

What we’re looking for:

  • You have experience managing 6- to 7-figure budgets — and more importantly, you can speak to results, efficiencies, and mistakes you’ve learned from.

  • You have experience leading teams (our Marketing team is likely to grow to 5-8+ next year). You’ve been a player/coach before — you can jump in where needed to ensure stuff gets done and nothing gets dropped.

  • Background in a marketing related field. Experience with performance marketing and/or growth marketing preferred. ROAS and CAC are part of your regular vocabulary — better yet, your performance has been evaluated on these KPIs in past roles.

  • You follow marketing trends and regularly get jazzed about new ideas and techniques. You regularly conduct small experiments to validate ideas, you see this as one of your favourite parts of the job.

  • You have a deep passion for changing the education system: You have your own reasons for creating this change, and the ambition to want to scale it.

  • You’re obsessed with storytelling: You understand how powerful narratives are to change human behavior.

  • You have high standards: We're building a world-class brand and cannot settle for mediocrity especially when we share things that are public facing.

 

Benefits/Perks

  • Build relationships with the next generation of unicorn founders

  • Competitive compensation

  • Complete ownership and autonomy

  • Network with influential people

  • Work with smart people who enjoy high-quality conversations

  • Access to TKS program content – always be learning 💡

 

Three reasons why people join the TKS team:

  1. The fulfillment and joy of helping ambitious young people discover their passion, achieve their potential, and make lifelong friendships. We have a meaningful impact on peoples' lives who will shape the future.

  2. Work with awesome mission-driven people who want to make the world a better place. The people at TKS are kind, intelligent, fun, and authentic. There's no politics here.

  3. Have flexibility and ownership over your time. We value results, which is directly correlated with the growth of the students and their enjoyment in the program.

Ps. Yes, we offer health benefits, vacation, swag, and other nice perks.

results.title: Senior Marketing Manager, ABM
results.description:
About Census 🔁

Census is how data teams at companies like Figma, Notion, Rippling, Clearbit, and Fivetran build better business operations.

With Census, analysts can turn their data warehouse into a single source of truth and publish their insights directly into the apps that marketing, sales, and success teams use daily. With richer customer data, these teams can build better campaigns, understand what users are doing, and ultimately drive more sustainable revenue.

Backed by a16z and Sequoia, we're a hybrid team headquartered in San Francisco who love taking annoying problems most people avoid and building elegant solutions for them. We believe that data should be used for more than just making charts. This is why we built the first integration platform that works directly within cloud data warehouses.

This is an opportunity for an entrepreneurial marketer to shape the future data SaaS landscape.

You will reshape the world for target prospects. Through empathy, education, savvy positioning, and a little hustle, you’ll compel prospects to change how they see the world and motivate them to act.

You will be the leading edge. You’ll discover ways to reach and activate prospects. You’ll work hand in hand with business development and sales teams to validate your strategies and worth with growth and ops to scale these strategies.

You’ll have a direct impact. You will find success in creating real sales opportunities and your work will contribute directly to Census’ growth trajectory. The best part: you’ll have the resources, the organizational support, and the product offering to make it happen.

You will help Census grow. As a member of a collaborative organization, you will contribute to our collective knowledge and our bottom line. You will help deepen our understanding of our current and future customers and have the opportunity to learn from a range of teams and cultures. 


About you

You are a matchmaker. You have a sharp instinct for identifying unspoken needs and designing the propositions to address them. 

You are results-driven. The latest ABM targeting technology or Dungeons and Dragons and Data event invite? Yes. If it drives demand, it’s on the table. 

You are a strategic thinker. You see the interconnectivity in every touchpoint in the customer journey and you know how to orchestrate multi-channel, multi-touch ad campaigns. 

You move quickly. You know when speed beats perfection and that perfection is reached through iteration. You have the tact to unblock yourself and the will to drive action.

You are collaborative. You’ll partner with growth, ABM, content, events, sales, BD, and ops to transform strategies into results. You’ll educate the broader organization on what works and most importantly, why it works.

You are customer-centric to the core. You are not afraid to explore your audience’s ecosystem and engage with them through conversations online and in person. 

Responsibilities

  • Develop and implement 1:1 and 1:few ABM programs and initiatives that achieve quarterly goals.

  • Execute highly targeted multi-touch, multi-channel campaigns that span from lead gen to sales opportunity. 

  • Create alignment and focus functional experts (ABM, events, community, ads, web,  content, email, experimentation, and sales development.) 

  • Develop target account lists and own lead segmentation

  • Pair with product marketing to identify and explore new verticals, new personas, and new propositions. You will always be testing new playbooks. 

  • Design experiences that span across ads, personalized landing pages, direct mail, outbound email campaigns.

  • Collaborate with content, design, ads, ABM, ops, growth, sales, and BD colleagues.

  • Measure and report on the effectiveness of these campaigns using Hubspot and BI tools.

  • Build and scale email nurture / re-engage programs in Hubspot to drive responses and push qualified leads further down the funnel for conversion.

  • Manage a growth-oriented budget based that scales with performance

Requirements

  • 3+ years in demand generation, preferably for B2B SaaS, or data products

  • 1+ years running multi-touch ABM plays 

  • Strong copywriting skills for email, ads, and social

  • Ability to tailor brand voice and messaging to various audiences

  • Excited about and motivated by B2B sales metrics

  • Strong interpersonal skills and the desire to work with both marketing and sales teams

  • Ability to lead creative discussions and collaborate with creative counterparts

  • Comfortable in (hopefully excited by) fast-paced startup environment

  • Familiarity with Hubspot, email marketing, and marketing automation

  • Excellent project management skills with strong attention to detail

#LI-Remote

Our benefits 🏆

  • Competitive salary and equity

  • Health, dental, and vision insurance (full platinum coverage for dependents)

  • 401k with 4% match

  • Flexible time off (20+ days/year recommended)

  • Parental leave

Census is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity and inclusion at our company. We welcome people of different nationalities, backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives.

What are you waiting for? Apply ⬇️

results.title: Proposal & Communications Manager
results.description:
Come join our Growth team! 

 

The Opportunity

A growing company of less than 50,  you will join an ambitious team of builders -- across engineering, growth, product, and data -- all focused on using technology to improve the lives and outcomes for people going through career transitions. We bring innovation, creativity, and empathy to our work, and care deeply about the impact our technology can have on our customers and users.

 

We are looking to hire a Proposal & Communications Manager to own the end-to-end process for both FutureFit AI’s responses to RFP’s and our overall external communications.

 

As our Proposal & Communications Manager, you will lead all aspects of written content and project management for FutureFit AI’s responses to strategic opportunities, including requests for proposals (RFPs). You will also have the opportunity to own our overall communications efforts (e.g., copywriting for newsletter, messaging on websites / social media, press releases, case studies, etc.) to help FutureFit AI distill and communicate our brand identity and impact externally.

 

How You’ll Fulfill Your Mission

  • Create winning proposals for FutureFit AI solutions that address prospective partners’ requirements while highlighting FutureFit AI’s experience and unique advantages.

  • Manage overall RFP activities (e.g., initial requirements mapping,  stakeholder management, drafting, editing, reviewing, etc.) to ensure a best-in-class and on-time submission. 

  • Develop and manage project plans (timelines, milestones, dependencies, deliverables) for specific proposal and communications projects.

  • Build and maintain strong partnerships with both internal team members and FutureFit AI’s external partners to better develop, coordinate, direct, and facilitate strategic communications designed to meet business goals.

  • Research and understand key business challenges, customer behaviors, target audiences, competitive dynamics, and environmental factors to help develop relevant and valuable written content

  • Document and share results and best practices with internal stakeholders, and help ensure consistency in style across all written content.

 

Why We Value You

We strongly believe that the quality of talent is best measured by motivation, alignment of purpose, skills, depth of experiences, and learning agility. While your past learning and work experiences help us understand who you are, what has shaped you, and what you have been exposed to, we do not use minimum education or years of experience requirements in our job postings.

  • Experienced. You should bring relevant work experience in proposal writing, communications, and/or research. Specific experience in spaces such as workforce development, economic development, education, technology, or public sector is a plus.

  • Written Communication. You have stellar narrative writing  and editing skills, and are also able to respond to highly technical requirements.

  • Creative Execution: You know how to develop content and direct creative execution to provide a consistent, targeted, and impactful message.

  • Collaborative. You are able to own end-to-end processes, pulling in the right people and expertise at the right time and collaborating with FutureFit AI partner stakeholders where applicable.

  • Project Management. You bring strong project management and multi-tasking skills, as well as the ability to work effectively in situations requiring adherence to tight deadlines.

  • Agile. You are comfortable navigating ambiguity and working with many competing priorities. You maintain composure and remain positive and strategic under pressure.

  • Detail-Oriented. You obsess over small details that you know can have a huge impact on the success of the projects you lead.

  • Passionate. You are passionate about using technology to improve the lives and outcomes for people going through career transitions.

 

Location: There is a preference (but not requirement) for this role to be based in New York City, but applications will be considered from anywhere in the US or Canada.

Compensation: $70,000 to $120,000 based on applied experience, geographic location, and other factors identified by the hiring committee.

 

Benefits: We provide a generous benefits package to all of our team members, including unlimited PTO, health care, technology reimbursement, and flexible schedules.

 

About FutureFit AI 

FutureFit AI believes that the greatest challenge of the Future of Work is facilitating successful career transitions, and our mission is to address that challenge by using AI to transform the education and economic mobility of 100 million people in the next 10 years. 

FutureFit AI is a growing, well-funded, company focused on using technology to improve the lives and outcomes for people going through career transitions. We bring innovation, creativity, and empathy to our work, and care deeply about the impact our technology can have on our customers and users.

 

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.


© FutureFit AI All rights reserved, we are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We encourage people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives to apply.

results.title: Social Creator
results.description:
Are you a creative Social Creator with domain expertise and a passion for sharing your knowledge with others? Join the Contra Creator program to create and share high-quality projects and the portfolio of your dreams based on your unique skillset.

As a member of the Contra Creator program, you’ll be creating high-quality portfolio projects about social media. These will be featured on Contra and around the web. You will be paid $2000 USD for a 1 month project for the following scope.

 

Scope
  • Create and share 8 - 10 high-quality projects on your Contra Portfolio. Contra will help you choose the topics that will be most beneficial to your portfolio. We will also do SEO research on each topic to make sure your portfolio gets tons of visibility.
  • Host the content on your Contra portfolio that lives on your custom domain (we can help you get one if you don’t have one already)
  • Ensure that content is easy to share and engage with on social media platforms and other online channels
  • Share content on your social platforms and/or in communities

 

What We’re Looking For
  • Experience creating and editing high-quality content
  • Strong domain expertise
  • Active on social media and familiar with engagement strategies (a plus)

 

What You’ll Get
  • Build the Portfolio of your dreams 💭
  • Boost your reputation on Contra and as an independent
  • Increased discoverability of your unique expertise
  • Community of fellow freelancers and thought leaders

 

Examples of great portfolio projects
  • Favourite Notification Project
  • Mental Health & Wellness Project
  • OnBrand Media Project
  • How to Create a Top of Funnel Social Strategy Project

 

About Contra

The Contra team wants to continue to support the independent community and we believe there is no better way to do this than with paid opportunities 🚀

 

Contra allows Independents to build their digital portfolio, get discovered by clients around the world, and earn money commission-free; while connecting Clients with top Independent talent.

 

We believe in empowering people to work the way they want.

 

If you are passionate about sharing your knowledge and want to be part of a growing community of creators, please apply here!

 

Learn more about Contra here!

results.title: Content Manager
results.description:
Social Discovery Group is one of the world's largest groups of social discovery companies, which includes more than 40 different brands, an investment fund, and a venture studio.
We solve the problems of loneliness, isolation, and separation of people with the help of digital reality. Our products include both international dating sites operated by our subsidiary Dating Group and new social and entertainment apps created by SDG Lab. More than 180 million people in 100 different countries use the technologies we develop, and we aim to reach ten times that number.
Our team consists of more than 700 professionals and digital nomads who can work from any country in the world. Together, we develop services based on new communication principles, focusing on live video broadcasts, AI technologies, and game mechanics.

Currently, we have an opening for a Content Manager to join our team.

We expect from you:

  • English - C2 or native speaker;
  • Experience in data markup;
  • Experience in compiling datasets for training models.

Your tasks will be:

  • Labeling text data;
  • Compiling new datasets (text);
  • Editing datasets (text);
  • Testing labeled data.

We are happy to offer:

  • Work in the international team. We have employees from the US, UK, Cyprus, China, Colombia, and other countries in 11 offices around the world;
  • Health insurance;
  • 7 wellness days / 7 extra paid days off that can be used to solve everyday issues, lie down and recover without sick leave or just relax;
  • Participation in international conferences and professional trainings;
  • Corporate discount for English classes, participation in sports events, a running club, and yoga online;
  • Own line of branded clothes and accessories with corporate symbols for various occasions (Welcome Pack when joining our team, a gift after probation, for professional holidays and corporate parties);
  • Internal gamified gratitude system: receive bonuses from colleagues and exchange them for days off, merch, team buildings, massage certificates, etc.

results.title: Social Media Manager
results.description:

results.title: Content Writer
results.description:
Description

 

Are you an advanced WordPress user, very familiar with plugins, themes and hostings? Do you love writing engaging content? Are you able to set up a test website, optimize, analyze and then explain these technical topics in simple words?

If you answered yes to these questions, we are sure this position will sound super exciting to you. 🤩

We are looking for a friendly person, who loves to write, to produce high-quality technical content for WP Rocket, Imagify, and RocketCDN. 🚀

Keep reading for more details! 📝

 

Become Our Content Writer!

In your job as a Content Writer, you will write and manage content that builds credibility and authority for the company. 

In this role, you will report directly to the Content Marketing Manager. You will join our marketing team, which is based in Europe. We work remotely, and ideally you should live in a country that aligns with the European Timezone.

We are so curious to know which new country will be added to our distributed team map! 🌍

What You Will Be Doing:

In your everyday job as a Content Writer, you will be dealing with technical products. You are a skilled wordsmith who has proven software development experience. You will conduct research, set website environments, perform speed tests, write new content and update existing ones. 

Here is a list describing the missions involved in this position (do you happen to like making lists? So do we!):

  • Build Expertise: You will conduct research on industry-related topics and need to stay up-to-date with the latest trends (the Core Web Vitals have no secret for you!). You will also make edits to existing content in an effort to improve readability, SEO, accuracy, and keep the content up-to-date overall.
  • Drive Traffic: You will identify target keywords on a specific topic and structure your content accordingly
  • Develop Branding: You will identify a unique angle to address the topic, that will show a different perspective or view, which will make the article especially interesting
  • Increase engagement: You will write engaging, easy-to understand and accurate content (such as: blog posts, release announcements,…) You will use a conversational tone to make our products accessibles and to engage our audience.

 

What Do You Need To Excel at This Job:

Proven working experience in writing and editing.

You have a solid experience in creating well-structured content, in a conversational tone to guide beginners and more advanced WordPress users. You understand the importance of SEO and how to address it through your content writing.

Tech-savvy with well-honed web performance knowledge.

You have experience with web performance optimization. You know how to measure page load speeds. You understand caching. Terms like gzip, preload, minify, and lazyload are not foreign to you. You know the difference between PageSpeed score and page load time.

Advanced knowledge and understanding of WordPress.

You have a working knowledge of WordPress: you can set up a local website to test out products and services. You are familiar with the various types of plugins, themes and hostings. You have written a few articles about WordPress.

Fluency in English.

You will need to be able to effectively write and communicate in English, respectfully, and professionally. You can proofread your work. 

Do you want to know three other things we appreciate about our candidates?

  • A startup mentality 
    You are doer, you are adaptable and you like to evolve in a fast-paced environment.
  • Previous remote job experience.
    Slack will be your virtual office, where all the life of the company takes place.
  • The involvement in the WordPress community.
    We support our teammates to attend and/or speak at WordCamps and volunteer within the community.

    • Influence the product roadmap with well-defined market requirements.

  • Field Enablement

    • Work with Field Sales, Sales Operations and Sales Enablement teams to develop enablement and training materials and programs that resonate with the buying audience and communicate the value of the Thought Industries solution.

  • Assist Customer Marketing in the creation of customer references and  testimonials for external and internal use.

  • Thought Leadership: 

    • Collaborate with the Content Strategy team to create industry leading thought leadership content and event programming. 

    • Articulate the value of the Thought Industries platform via quantitative customer case studies, product videos, and website copy, as needed

    • Provide expert guidance, when requested, for marketing emails, content marketing, and customer communications.

  • Other Responsibilities:

    • Provide input into value-based messaging, and assist the Sales team in improving RFP success rates.

    • Assist the Product team in launching and communicating product updates and improvements. 

     



Qualifications

Sound like something you’d love to do? Fantastic! Your background and experience should include, but is not necessarily limited to the following:

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, or related field desired.

  • 7-9+ years of experience working in a B2B SaaS-focused product marketing role. 

  • Experience owning and strategic GTM planning and execution in a fast-growing tech environment 

  • Experience working with a direct sales team, as well as with product management and customer success teams.

  • Deep understanding of software, manufacturing, or telecom industries 

  • Self-starter eager to own projects and take the initiative where there’s room for improvement

  • Demonstrated ability to communicate the value of a product to solving business challenges. We want to communicate “why” more than “what.”

  • Strong left brain / right brain execution that combines creativity with analytical rigor. 

  • Excellent written and in-person communication skills. Our team works 100% remotely and it's important that we're able to understand each other through text and spoken word. 

  • Eagerness to collaborate, learn, and contribute. You’re equally comfortable writing content for a sales sheet and landing page as you are defining and managing the various components of a product launch.

  • Previous experience with Customer Education and/or online learning software is preferred 

  • Comfortable working closely with leadership teams at a cross-departmental level

  • Passionate, motivated and hungry to succeed



Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

 

Thought Industries does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. Employment decisions at Thought Industries are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities.

results.title: Product Marketing Manager
results.description:
About Mangomint

Mangomint is a fast-growing Series A stage SaaS company on a mission to provide next-generation software that embeds so seamlessly into the day-to-day activities of salons and spas, that it effectively disappears. Our platform is used (and loved!) daily by more than 10,000 salon and spa professionals in the U.S. and Canada to handle everything from appointment booking, staff management, payment processing, and so much more.

Backed by one of the leading product-led growth VCs, you can be sure the opportunity to work at Mangomint is filled with possibilities.

We’re still a pretty small team but we’re doing really BIG things. We’re a fully remote, fun and hard-working team with the occasional in-person meetup every few months. Come build with us!


About the Role

Our ideal Product Marketing Manager is a growth-minded, customer journey obsessed self-starter who has deep experience collaborating with product, marketing, sales and customer success teams to develop GTM strategy, perfect product positioning and drive customer acquisition, adoption and expansion.

As our first dedicated product marketing hire, this role will lead the charge in driving core product marketing functions — think product launches, value-based messaging, market and competitor research, ICP and persona development, sales enablement, etc. — and also work closely with product and engineering to identify, test and implement in-product growth levers.

This role sits at the intersection of product, product marketing and growth in a strong PLG-focused organization and is the perfect opportunity for a nimble and analytical rising growth leader.

What you’ll be doing

  • Own core product marketing functions including product launches, value-based messaging, market and competitor research, ICP and persona development, sales enablement, etc.
  • Lead the growth charge; strategize and execute on growth experiments and in-product loops that drive signups, usage, and retention
  • Measure the effectiveness of product marketing and growth efforts; connect impact to key business metrics
  • Analyze data to pinpoint high impact opportunities and manage prioritization of future experiments and initiatives
  • Build messaging and positioning for Mangomint products that clearly communicates our competitive advantage in the market
  • Intimately understand our market, customers and competitive landscape; you are the voice of the customer
  • Optimize the full customer journey to maximize user experience and adoption (especially the free trial process)
  • Work collaboratively with product, marketing, sales, customer success and other internal teams
  • Influence strategy for and manage growth-oriented product roadmap initiatives
  • Help build cross-functional product management and product marketing processes at scale

Requirements

  • 2+ years of hands-on product marketing and/or growth marketing experience in B2B SaaS
  • Deep knowledge of product-led growth strategy and tactics; ability to look at all opportunities, experiments and initiatives through a PLG lens
  • Data obsessed with analytical mindset; organized in planning, executing and tracking performance
  • Strong testing mentality and ability to be analytical in everything you do
  • Extensive experience with product marketing functions like product launches, enablement, market research, ICP development, etc.
  • Exceptional ability to write product messaging that communicates value and connects to the market’s needs
  • Deep customer empathy and ability to impact experience across full customer journey
  • Proficiency with marketing and analytics tools (Segment, Mixpanel, Intercom, marketing automation, in-app messaging, CRM, etc.)
  • Strong project management skills, including ability prioritize high impact activities and move complex project forward efficiently and effectively
  • Extensive knowledge of SaaS product management processes; has the technical chops to collaborate with engineers
  • Curious, continuous learner who thrives in startup environment

Benefits

  • Unlimited PTO
  • Generous monthly wellness budget for gym memberships, yoga, spas, etc.
  • Premium subscription to the Calm app
  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • Lots of opportunities for career and personal growth
  • Remote work
  • Competitive compensation
  • Supportive environment with fun and respectful culture
  • 401k (no matching…yet)



Mangomint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, age, disability and genetic information (including family medical history).
